user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3,
                               const char *username,
                               const char *realm,
                               void *userhash_bin,
                               size_t bin_buf_size)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  if (! digest_init_one_time (&da, get_base_digest_algo (algo3)))
    return MHD_NO;
  if (digest_get_size (&da) > bin_buf_size)
    ret = MHD_NO;
  else
  {
    calc_userhash (&da,
                   username,
                   strlen (username),
                   realm,
                   strlen (realm),
                   userhash_bin);
    ret = MHD_YES;

#ifdef MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR
    if (digest_ext_error (&da))
      ret = MHD_NO;
#endif /* MHD_DIGEST_HAS_EXT_ERROR */
  }
  digest_deinit (&da);

  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No function parameter is assigned to or otherwise altered in this function. The parameters algo3, username, realm and userhash_bin are only used as values in expressions or passed to other functions; none of them are modified (no assignments, increments/decrements, or address-of (&) operations that would allow a callee to change the parameter itself). The call calc_userhash(..., userhash_bin) may modify the object pointed to by userhash_bin, but MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 permits modification of the object referred to by a pointer parameter — it only forbids modifying the pointer variable itself. Therefore there are no fragments in the provided code that require investigation under Rule 17.8.
